data.title: Abhi Sachdev on LinkedIn: #conversion
data.meta_description: We did it….! 58 weeks of hard work has finally paid off. We are finally live on Gap #Conversion into Barclays Bank US in partnership with Mastercard. Like all… | 40 comments on LinkedIn
data.text:
Acquiring the credit card portfolio of Gap Inc. and its family of brands including Old Navy; Gap; Banana Republic; Athleta has been one of the most exciting and complex projects we’ve undertaken within Barclays Bank US. We are now the exclusive issuer for Gap’s $3.5 billion credit card portfolio and have doubled our U.S. customer base. Cross-functional teams across the business put in more than one million hours of work to ensure we delivered for our new customers. Transformative technology changes were also made to provide seamless customer experiences. We are delighted to partner with such an iconic brand, one who shares our sustainability values and goals - Gap’s branded cards are made with a core of recycled plastic. I want to thank all of those involved for their hard work and collaborative spirit. And of course, to our 10 million new customers - welcome!

Once upon a time, there lived a crow. He was a firm believer in #YOLO. He used to fly far and wide to quench his thirst for life. One day, he flew across a large body of water to a restaurant he fancied. He feasted on some great leftovers that day. Chilli Chicken. Gobi Manchurian. Stuffed Kulchas. Name it. Midway through his flight back home, he received the call of nature in the form a grumbling stomach. He was flying over water and didn't want to do his pooping business there - because fish live there. Duh. As pressure built in his tummy, he began to look for an appropriate place to dump his misery. And then, a hundred metres or so away, he spotted an island. It was named LinkedIn. He hovered over LinkedIn for a few seconds, made sure nobody was in the path of his poop, and did the deed. It landed harmlessly and the relieved crow flew away. In a matter of minutes, the poop that landed on LinkedIn turned into a story. The story of a resourceful crow full of empathy. How it rose above the odds stacked against it and took a considerate and brave dump. A tale of courage and selflessness. An inspirational saga of an ordinary crow born to another ordinary crow from a humble background. "Be like the crow" or something along those lines would be the story's punchline. 𝙈𝙤𝙧𝙖𝙡: 𝘗𝘦𝘰𝘱𝘭𝘦 𝘰𝘯 𝘓𝘪𝘯𝘬𝘦𝘥𝘐𝘯 𝘩𝘢𝘷𝘦 𝘵𝘩𝘦 𝘶𝘯𝘤𝘢𝘯𝘯𝘺 𝘬𝘯𝘢𝘤𝘬 𝘰𝘧 𝘵𝘶𝘳𝘯𝘪𝘯𝘨 𝘢𝘯𝘺𝘵𝘩𝘪𝘯𝘨, 𝘣𝘪𝘳𝘥 𝘱𝘰𝘰𝘱 𝘪𝘯𝘤𝘭𝘶𝘥𝘦𝘥, 𝘪𝘯𝘵𝘰 𝘮𝘰𝘵𝘪𝘷𝘢𝘵𝘪𝘰𝘯𝘢𝘭 𝘴𝘵𝘰𝘳𝘪𝘦𝘴 𝘴𝘵𝘶𝘥𝘥𝘦𝘥 𝘸𝘪𝘵𝘩 𝘮𝘢𝘯𝘢𝘨𝘦𝘮𝘦𝘯𝘵 𝘭𝘦𝘴𝘴𝘰𝘯𝘴. 𝘛𝘩𝘦 𝘭𝘢𝘵𝘦𝘴𝘵 𝘷𝘪𝘤𝘵𝘪𝘮 𝘰𝘧 𝘵𝘩𝘪𝘴 𝘣𝘦𝘩𝘢𝘷𝘪𝘰𝘶𝘳 𝘪𝘴 𝘙𝘢𝘧𝘢𝘦𝘭 𝘕𝘢𝘥𝘢𝘭 𝘢𝘯𝘥 𝘩𝘪𝘴 𝘷𝘪𝘤𝘵𝘰𝘳𝘺 𝘢𝘵 𝘵𝘩𝘦 𝘈𝘶𝘴𝘵𝘳𝘢𝘭𝘪𝘢𝘯 𝘖𝘱𝘦𝘯. 𝘈𝘯𝘥 𝘵𝘩𝘢𝘵 𝘪𝘯 𝘵𝘶𝘳𝘯 𝘣𝘦𝘤𝘰𝘮𝘦𝘴 𝘧𝘶𝘦𝘭 𝘧𝘰𝘳 𝘮𝘺 𝘤𝘰𝘯𝘵𝘦𝘯𝘵. 𝘉𝘦𝘤𝘢𝘶𝘴𝘦 𝘦𝘹𝘤𝘳𝘦𝘮𝘦𝘯𝘵 𝘮𝘢𝘬𝘦𝘴 𝘨𝘳𝘦𝘢𝘵 𝘧𝘦𝘳𝘵𝘪𝘭𝘪𝘻𝘦𝘳, 𝘯𝘰? #copywriting #contentstrategy #storytelling #themoraltroll
